and start your search for houses for sale in Southeast Edmonton here.
data.text:
Learn About The Southeast Quadrant of Edmonton

Search Southeast Edmonton homes for sale with Housinaminute! Buyers have their pick of new listings spanning communities such as Strathearn, Argyll, Capilano, Maple Ridge, Tamarack, Walker, and more. Filter your search by number of bedrooms and bathrooms, listing date or price range to make finding your Southeast Edmonton dream home all the easier.

Real Estate Statistics

Southeast Edmonton Communities:

Southeast Edmonton's defining boundaries include Gateway Boulevard to the west, the North Saskatchewan River Valley to the north, Anthony Henday to the east and 41st Ave to the south. As one of the largest quadrants in Edmonton, the area encompasses dozens of flourishing neighbourhoods, including those of Mill Woods, The Meadows, Ellerslie, Decoteau, Burnewood, Knottwood, Lakewood, etc.

Extremely diverse, each Southeast Edmonton neighbourhood has something to offer buyers of every taste and lifestyle. For instance, residents of Summerside enjoy year-round waterfront recreation thanks to Summerside Lake, while those living in Silverberry appreciate having a 234,000+ square foot recreation centre in the heart of their community. From established neighbourhoods with oversized lots to developing new communities boasting the latest home styles, Southeast Edmonton offers no shortage of unique places to live.

Southeast Edmonton Home Styles and Price Ranges:

Home styles in this popular part of the city offer everything from single-family homes and duplexes to low-maintenance townhomes and apartment-style condos. Three-bedroom, three-bathroom detached properties in Southwest Edmonton typically start in the mid-300s and feature an average of 1,200 square feet of living space. Southeast Edmonton single-family homes also vary in size and style and include bungalows, bi-levels, four-level splits, and two-storey front attached and laned models. Three-bedroom attached and semi-detached Southwest Edmonton homes may start as low as $200,000*.

Amenities in Southeast Edmonton:

Extremely family-friendly, Southwest Edmonton is characterized by secular and non-secular schools of all grades, languages and learning abilities. The area also has several popular shopping districts, including South Edmonton Common, Mill Woods Town Centre and Whyte Ave. Big-box and boutique retailers, restaurants, professional services, health services (including Grey Nuns Hospital) and other essential amenities are easily accessible in Southeast Edmonton.

Commuting From Southeast Edmonton:

Thanks to arterial roads such as the Sherwood Park Fwy (82nd Ave), Whitemud Drive, Wayne Gretzky Drive (75th Street), the Anthony Henday and Gateway Boulevard, Southeast Edmonton residents enjoy a streamlined commute to just about anywhere. Besides several major transit centres, locals now have access to the Valley LRT line, which runs from Mill Woods to West Edmonton.

Recreation Opportunities:

Southeast Edmonton is home to some of the city's most popular parks. These include Jackie Parker Off-Leash Dog Park, Gold Bar Park, Gallagher Park and Forest Heights Park, to name a few. Other notable green spaces in Southwest Edmonton include the North Saskatchewan River Valley, Mill Woods Golf Course and the scenic Mill Creek Ravine. Last but not least, several leisure centres define the area, such as Bonnie Doon Leisure Centre, the Meadows Community Recreation Centre and Mill Woods Recreation Centre.

Why Southeast Edmonton? With its picturesque neighbourhoods, excellent schools, and abundant amenities, this part of the city offers an exceptional lifestyle for families, professionals, and retirees alike. Whether you're looking for a spacious suburban home, a trendy townhouse, or a luxury condo with stunning city views, Southeast Edmonton has it all. So why wait? Embark on your home search today and discover the best homes for sale in Southeast Edmonton!
